hero.title: Your Sustainable Legal Partner Towards Success

about.title: About Qefan
about.description: Qefan Law Firm & Legal Consultancy was established through an alliance of legal expertise in the fields of general and administrative judiciary in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, alongside extensive experience working in executive departments in the public, private, and non-profit sectors. These combined experiences have shaped our approach to providing sound legal opinions.

goals.title: Qefan's Goals
goals.goal2: Achieving preventive and sustainable justice for the client
goals.goal3: Providing services with complete transparency and integrity
goals.goal4: Professional legal representation for the client

service1.title: Litigation
service1.description: Qefan provides comprehensive litigation services, including studying the client's position, drafting legal memoranda, and pleading before judicial authorities and quasi-judicial committees through our licensed team.
service1.audience: Government agencies, Non-profit organizations, Local and foreign companies, Businessmen
service1.outputs: Studying the client's position by specialists, Professional legal pleading before judicial authorities, Preparation and review of legal memoranda and regulations, Following up on client's rights collection

service2.title: Contract & Agreement Drafting
service2.description: Contract and agreement drafting and review services to strengthen the legal position of parties and reduce litigation, while identifying potential disputes and providing preventive solutions.
service2.audience: Government agencies, Non-profit organizations, Local and foreign companies, Businessmen
service2.outputs: Reviewing contracting parties' obligations, Studying potential effects of contracts and agreements, Drafting and reviewing contracts by expert specialists, Aligning agreement drafting with legal texts

service3.title: Legal Consultations
service3.description: Providing legal consultancy services to public, private, and non-profit entities through a specialized team that has practiced in many specialized agencies and earned trust and empowerment.
service3.audience: Government agencies, Non-profit organizations, Local and foreign companies, Businessmen
service3.outputs: Studying and analyzing client needs by specialists, Accurately defining results and targets, Preparing comprehensive legal studies with recommendations

service4.title: Legal Representation
service4.description: Providing legal representation and negotiation services for public, private, and non-profit entities in pre-contracting stages and important decision-making, to ensure legal soundness and protection from potential effects and risks.
service4.audience: Government agencies, Non-profit organizations, Local and foreign companies, Individuals, Businessmen
service4.outputs: Studying and analyzing client needs by specialists, Defining negotiation scope according to client wishes, Specialist attendance and representing client position in meetings, Providing client with achieved results and their effects

service5.title: Liquidation Services
service5.description: Providing comprehensive liquidation services for assets and debts through a specialized team according to established regulatory standards.
service5.outputs: Professional plan for all liquidation stages, Live and effective communication with related parties, Services provided with integrity and transparency for all liquidation parties, Excellent execution and periodic reports for each stage

service6.title: Entity Establishment
service6.description: Providing optimal options and practical experience in establishing private or non-profit entities, including preparing bylaws, registration with relevant authorities, and accompanying executive management to ensure sound legal construction of the entity.
service6.audience: Businessmen, Companies, Startups, Endowments and non-profit sector
service6.outputs: Studying and analyzing client aspirations through specialists, Professional work plan for all establishment stages, Establishing and preparing entity bylaws by specialists, Excellent execution and periodic reports for each stage

service7.title: Entity Inspection
service7.description: Our specialized team excels in inspecting private and non-profit entities to ensure proactive compliance and oversight work in multiple agencies. Qefan seeks to protect clients from regulatory violations, potential regulatory risks in mergers and acquisitions, or self-oversight to achieve transparency and integrity.
service7.audience: Businessmen, Investment funds, Board members and executive experts in private and non-profit entities, Local and foreign companies
service7.outputs: Providing comprehensive inspection and evaluation before merger and acquisition processes, Protecting capital and emerging projects, Providing beneficial inspection report for client awareness, Contributing to client's sound decision-making

service8.title: Mergers & Acquisitions
service8.description: Qefan serves as the specialized arm for those wishing to merge their capital with others or acquire another entity, through legal entity inspection and potential risk study to demonstrate legal position soundness.
service8.outputs: Preparing detailed report on target entity, Preparing disclosure documents, Preparing comprehensive due diligence reports, Designing optimal deal structure, Reviewing and controlling all agreements and formal documents, Representing client during deal negotiations for best results, Managing regulatory procedures and obtaining approvals from relevant authorities, Providing legal support to ensure smooth transition and guaranteed opportunities

service9.title: Arbitration & Mediation
service9.description: Qefan takes pride in its team's experience in the judicial and legal profession, specializing in major and precise cases. We strive to achieve justice for arbitrating parties and provide professional solutions for their disputes, ensuring complete confidentiality and impartiality in mediation.
service9.outputs: Providing procedurally comprehensive services according to best international practices, Activating advanced technical means to expedite procedures, Decision-making with complete transparency and integrity, Maintaining confidentiality through specialized secretaries

service10.title: Legislation & Policy Governance
service10.description: Qefan's team takes pride in its expertise in drafting legislation and governing executive department policies across all sectors, and drafting policies and procedural guides that regulate executive department operations in all their technical specializations.
service10.audience: Local and foreign companies, Board members and executive experts, Non-profit entities
service10.outputs: Providing procedurally comprehensive services according to best international practices, Activating advanced technical means to expedite procedures, Decision-making with complete transparency and integrity, Maintaining confidentiality through specialized secretaries

service11.title: White Land Fees & Vacant Real Estate Program
service11.description: A specialized legal and consultancy service for managing and handling obligations related to the White Land Fees system, including studying the land's status and assessing its liability for fees, preparing and submitting objections and grievances to the competent authorities, requesting statutory extensions, and handling cases related to financed or mortgaged lands with banks and financing entities, with follow-up before the competent authorities to reduce financial obligations or cancel fees when regulatory justifications exist. Our practical experience has resulted in recovering more than 250 million SAR for our clients, serving more than 50 clients from individuals and companies, with success in obtaining approval for more than 80 extension requests on invoices.
service11.audience: Land owners within urban boundaries subject to the regulation, Real estate sector investors, Real estate development and investment companies, Holding companies owning real estate portfolios, Partners or heirs in joint lands, Owners of financed or mortgaged lands with banks and financing entities
service11.outputs: Legal study of the property's status and its liability for fees, Assessment of regulatory obligations and risks, Preparation and submission of objections and grievances to competent authorities, Submission of extension requests and invoice processing, Preparation of legal memoranda and responses, Follow-up on the White Land Fees program platform and messages, Providing regulatory solutions to reduce or cancel fees, Legally representing the client before competent authorities

clients.title: Our Clients
clients.subtitle: We are proud to work with a distinguished group of clients

team.title: Qefan Team
team.subtitle: Our team includes a group of distinguished specialists

member1.name: Ibrahim bin Abdulaziz Al-Hussain
member1.description: Licensed lawyer and founding partner holding a Master's degree in Sharia Policy from the Higher Institute of Judiciary. He holds the Sharia Consultant Fellowship in Islamic Finance Jurisprudence and Banking Dispute Resolution. He provides specialized legal consultations to companies and individuals in commercial, labor, and administrative fields. A certified arbitrator from appellate courts and a certified expert and notary. He possesses extensive experience in litigation and pleading before judicial authorities and committees, ensuring the delivery of precise and effective legal solutions to support compliance and protect client interests.

member2.name: Omar bin Ali Al-Doeelej
roles: Expert in Real Estate Disputes & Partnership Conflicts
member2.description: Licensed lawyer and founding partner holding the ICCGo certificate and accredited in providing governance services from the London Academy of Governance and Compliance. A certified expert at the Ministry of Justice in providing legal services. He possesses extensive experience in real estate disputes and corporate conflicts, representing clients in real estate cases, real estate fund agreements, and real estate development, combining legal expertise with practical application to support the interests of individuals and companies.

member3.name: Omar bin Abdulrahman Al-Faifi
roles: Corporate Governance, Risk Management & Compliance Expert
member3.description: Licensed lawyer with practical experience in several legal and consultancy firms, specializing in corporate governance, risk management, and compliance according to best global practices. He provides consultations and solutions that enhance effective governance, institutional compliance, and support business sustainability. He holds the ICCGO certificate in governance, risk management, and compliance, in addition to several professional certifications, enabling him to deliver comprehensive added value to companies and individuals.

member4.name: Khaled bin Mohammed Al-Harbi
member4.description: Licensed lawyer who practiced judicial work for years, accumulating deep expertise in studying and analyzing specialized cases and judicial decision-making. He holds a Master's degree in Comparative Jurisprudence and worked in the Technical Office for studying specialized cases and the Supreme Court, granting him advanced practical experience in supporting the highest judiciary and formulating sound legal opinions. He earned the trust of the judicial apparatus to represent it in international and local forums, and participated in specialized administrative and legislative committees, contributing to the development of judicial regulations and policies. He combines Sharia and legal knowledge with the ability to draft legislation and analyze regulations.

member5.name: Omar bin Abdulaziz Al-Sulaim
member5.description: Expert and practitioner in business development, policy and procedure building, inspection, and investigation, holding a Master's degree in Oversight. He worked as a legal consultant at the Vision Realization Office and served as supervisor and monitor of endowment entities at the General Authority for Endowments, in addition to his previous experience as an investigator and prosecutor at the Public Prosecution. He participated in numerous international conferences and courses in artificial intelligence and financial inspection according to IMF policies, combining legal, oversight, and technical expertise to support governance, compliance, and institutional development.

member6.name: Hisham bin Mohammed Al Sumaih
member6.description: Judicial legal consultant with over ten years of practical judicial experience spanning criminal, personal status, and general courts. His career culminated at the Jeddah Court of Appeal, connected with administrative achievement and development from assistant to the president of the General Court in Riyadh to supervising the General Judiciary Unit at the Ministry's Agency for Judicial Affairs. He has participated in numerous judicial development committees and projects, delivered many training courses, and served as a certified trainer at the Judicial Training Center. He is also a certified arbitrator from the London Academy of Governance and Compliance.

member7.name: Fahad Al-Murshid
roles: Legal Consultant in Insurance, Zakat & Tax
member7.description: Licensed lawyer with experience in several law firms, having represented companies in retail and contracting sectors and provided specialized consultations in legal and regulatory aspects. He holds the ICCGO certificate in governance and risk management and possesses qualified experience in providing consultations in cooperative insurance, zakat, and tax fields, enhancing his ability to provide clients with comprehensive legal solutions that support compliance and sustainable growth.

member8.name: Issa Khawaji
member8.description: Consultant and expert in entity governance, holding a Master's degree in Law. He possesses executive experience in managing several organizations in the non-profit sector and participated in drafting and building numerous regulations and policies, in addition to practical experience in developing comprehensive governance systems that enhance sustainability and transparency in the third sector. He also works as a certified trainer in the legal and administrative field, contributing to capacity building and institutional competency development.
